intro: Rhinanthus helenae, commonly known as Helen's red top, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its bright orange or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
